page.title: 08HOUSING AROUND TADLEY
page.content: Outside Tadley and Baughurst the survey area is sparsely populated. A small council estate in Brimpton and the hamlet of Brimpton Common are the only 'major centres of population'. Every size and shape of house from the mansion to one bedroom bungalows are represented, however. Apart from the council houses and ten farm workers houses all the houses are owner occupied and very expensive. A few small cottages, costing in 1985 Â£50-60,000 still exist but mainly they are the larger, modern five bed, three bath types or 'three-knocked-into-one' cottages, with prices starting around Â£100,000. This is a very desirable area in house agents jargon. People are generally concerned about the possibility of urban sprawl spreading into the country, they tend not to want more facilities locally.
